oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Bonnie Blue Flag
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "The Bonnie Blue Flag" sheet music, dedicated to General John W. Geary and the Second Division, Twentieth Army Corps, United States Army. Entered according the Act of Congress A. D. 1864, by H. H. K. Elliott in the Clerks Office of the District Court of the Eastern District of Pennsylvania.

Information taken from inside cover: "The Bonnie Blue Flag" a Blue Flag, six feet square, with a white Star in the Centre, is the Battle or Field Flag of Gen. Geary's 2d division, 20th Corps, now in the Army of the Cumberland. This designation was ordered by General Hooker in his organization of the Army of the Potomac, to which the Division was then attached, in the Spring of 1863. The Rebels first saw the Flag at Chancellorsville, afterwards at Gettysburg, where it was recongnized by its old opponents.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Confederate States of America - History; Geary, John White, 1819-1873
Sheet music covers; Songs; Music
